body:
A fair amount of time is spent waiting on the server, but not all of it. @andymikulski's suggestions still make sense along side server improvements.

We should definitely be disabling Redux Logger in production builds, to avoid the slow down it causes. After this, I imagine bulk loading might help a bit, but will be less impactful. Still worth doing though, if it doesn't hurt maintainability of the code.

The cachebusting technique you describe sounds a lot like etags to me. We may be able to implement that in a performant way, and return `304 Not Modified` if the etag matches. The trick here will be to figure out if the etag matches without making a full request, which would negate most of the benefit it would have provided.

A fair amount of time is spent waiting on the server, but not all of it. @andymikulski's suggestions still make sense along side server improvements.

We should definitely be disabling Redux Logger in production builds, to avoid the slow down it causes. After this, I imagine bulk loading might help a bit, but will be less impactful. Still worth doing though, if it doesn't hurt maintainability of the code.

The cachebusting technique you describe sounds a lot like etags to me. We may be able to implement that in a performant way, and return 304 Not Modified if the etag matches. The trick here will be to figure out if the etag matches without making a full request, which would negate most of the benefit it would have provided.
